reviews.author: UST Robot
reviews.title: Interesting Biochemistry Lab Course
reviews.comment_content:
8 Biochemistry Lab Courses
Practical 1: Buffers, Titrations and pH Measurement
Practical 2: Chromatography I (TLC)
Practical 3: Chromatography II (Gel Filtration Column Chromatography)
Practical 4: Protein Gel Electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE)
Practical 5: Spectrophotometry
Practical 6: Centrifugation
Practical 7: Metabolic Syndrome I (Glucose)
Practical 8: Metabolic Syndrome II (Lipid)

Very interesting and useful
1 lab per week
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching
Explains the principles very well
You can ask him questions if you don't know after the lab
Really helpful
Better to preview lab manual and LIFS2820 lecture notes before the lab
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail

This lab course counts attendance (16%), you have to submit 8 lab worksheets (16%) plus 1 assigned lab report (15%) punctually, and Final Exam (53%) only. I suppose that you will pass this course easily if you do these very well. No Mid-Term test!

Better to attend all the LIFS2820 lectures as Dr. Lam will tell you some tips that he may be asked in the Final Exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
8 lab worksheets and 1 assigned lab report

Lab worksheets: you can find the answers easily by Googling, TA pre-lab introduction and LIFS2820 lecture notes.
Score: Around 9-10/10

Lab report: you have to follow the guidelines to finish it. Spending 2 full days to finish it, super tiring.
Score: 10/10

Need to submit hardcopy and softcopy

Format of Final Exam: Only SQ and LQ
14 questions (1.5 hours)
Remember to review the lab manual and lab worksheets.

reviews.author: ggg_
reviews.comment_content:
This is the lab session that goes with LIFS2820. There are 8 labs in total this semester.
Lab1: BUFFERS, TITRATIONS AND pH MEASUREMENT
Lab2: CHROMATOGRAPHY I: AMINO ACID SEPARATION AND IDENTIFICATION
Lab3: CHROMATOGRAPHY II: GEL FILTRATION COLUMN CHROMATOGRAPHY
Lab4: ELECTROPHORESIS: PROTEIN GEL ELECTROPHORESIS
Lab5: SPECTROPHOTOMETRY: ENZYME KINETICS: LACTATE DEHYDROGENASE
Lab6: ORGANELLE ISOLATION BY CENTRIFUGATION AND MARKER ENZYME ASSAY
Lab7: METABOLIC SYNDROME (PART 1): GLUCOSE
Lab8: METABOLIC SYNDROME (PART 2): LIPID
Useful and basic laboratory techniques for biochemical research.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explains things quite clearly. However there are a few errors on the slides which may cause confusion. He replies emails promptly, which is quite helpful. I don't know why but he requires us to hand in both softcopy and hardcopy of the worksheets and report.
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F (the lecture session is graded)
I think you will be alright as long as you hand in all the worksheets and the assigned lab report on time. No midterm  and final.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. A worksheet for every lab and a report for one assigned lab. I spent a lot of time on the report, which seems unnecessary. Pay attention to what the professor and the TA said in class and it won't be too difficult. The TA's slides may provide some useful information and data. (But there may also be mistakes, follow the lab mannual if there is inconsistency.)

reviews.author: Yuumi
reviews.comment_content:
8 labs in total
Practical 01: Buffers,Titrations and pH Measurement
Practical 02: Amino Acid Separation and identification
Practical 03: Gel Filtration Column Chromatography
Practical 04: Protein Gel Electrophoresis
Practical 05: Enzyme Kinetics: Lactate Dehydrogenase
Practical 06: Organelle Isolation by Centrifugation and Marker Enzyme Assay
Practical 07: Metabolic Syndrome (Glucose)
Practical 08: Metabolic Syndrome (Lipid)
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lam's teaching is quite good and he is willing to answer every questions. Moreover, there will be a briefing session delivered by different TAs before the experiment starts so it is quite easy to follow given an overview of the whole procedures. And then Prof. Lam will explain a bit more details throughout the experiment. If you don't have time, just watch the recording and it's always more convenient as you can play it at 2x speed ;)
reviews.comment_grading:
Since the course is P/F this semester, I would say a pass is guaranteed as long as you've paid enough efforts.
Lab worksheets: 27%
Lab report: 20%
Final exam: 53%
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 8 laboratory worksheets in total and you have one week to finish them. Most of them are easy and only costed me about an hour to finish except for lab5, which requires many annoying graph drawings and calculations.
As for the lab report, you can just follow the outline given in the first lesson and its format is more or less same with the DSE biology SBA. The topic is randomly assigned based on 1 of the 5 labs. You will have 2 weeks to do and I've spent a whole day to finish it anyway.
Finally, the exam is a take-home assessment with a time limit of 24 hours and it's released during the study break. It consists of 10 long questions like creating a protocol, elaborating the principle and graph drawings. It's quite challenging as some questions can't be directly copied from the materials that he gave us on the lessons

reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. lam is my favorite professor in lifs department. In beginning of each lab session, each TA explains about lab protocol. He adds extra points that we have to aware of. He is always there to help you and explains stuff fairly well.
reviews.comment_grading:
9 labs*2%=18%----(lab performance and logbook)---you need a logbook to record all the data/details in the lab.
2%*9=18%----worksheets. There are 9 worksheets to be completed at each end of the lab.
11% for lab report- write one report. They randomly choose which lab session you have to write about.
rest-----53?54%=final exam! easy.
dk how much I got, but finally got A. fighting!
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. They expect 100% attendance except for any unexpected issues. The lab session is there for once a week. In the timetable, it takes up big chunk of 4 hours, but dont be scared. Most of the labs ends within 2 hours and some time consuming labs like lab5,6 and 9 takes some more time. There is enoguh time to finish the lab. Just doing prelab, worksheets and labreport everyweek is fair enough.

reviews.author: Minerva07
reviews.comment_content: there are 9 labs in total, including making buffers, titration, ion exchange chromatography, gel filtration chromatography, electrophoresis, enzyme kinetics, centrifugation, and some assays related to metabolic syndromes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
there are different TAs for different experiments, and they will explain the experiment in the first 20 minutes.
some TAs can explain the content well, others are hard to understand. generally, the slides cannot be seen clearly on the screen.
but during the experiment, TAs and technicians are really willing to help.
reviews.comment_grading:
there are no sub-grades for this course.
worksheet              18% (2 each)
performance          9%   (1 each experiment)
lab report               20%
final exam              53%
we did not get the marks of the final exam, so it is hard to tell whether the grading is good or not. however, the worksheet was graded by the respective TA of each experiment, so it is quite arbitrary.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is a little bit heavy for a 2-credit course.
1 lab report
9 worksheets
1 final exam
take attendance
